name: Life expectancy & population - Gapminder (2019), UN (2019), and OWID (2019)
title: Life expectancy & population - Gapminder (2019), UN (2019), and OWID (2019)
description:
This dataset presents estimates of life expectancy and population by country in 1800, 1950, 2015, and 2019.

For life expectancy in 1800, we use data provided by Gapminder. For life expectancy in 1950, 2015, and 2019, we use data published by the United Nations Population Division. For population, we use Our World in Data's Population dataset, from our page on World Population Growth: https://ourworldindata.org/world-population-growth.

sources.name: Gapminder (2019), UN (2019), and OWID (2019)

resources.path: Life expectancy & population - Gapminder (2019), UN (2019), and OWID (2019).csv

fields.name: Life expectancy
fields.description: Life expectancy at birth is defined as the average number of years that a newborn could expect to live if he or she were to pass through life subject to the age-specific mortality rates of a given period.

fields.name: Population
fields.description: Total number of people inhabiting a country.
